S1.4: Resource Analysis â€¢ Substance resources â€¢ Field resources â€¢ Space/Time/Info resources
S1.5: System Boundaries â€¢ System level â€¢ Super-system â€¢ Sub-system

ðŸ§¬ BB3: Substance-Field (Su-Field) & 76 Standard Solutions
S3.1: Model Su-Field â€¢ S1 - First substance â€¢ S2 - Second substance â€¢ F - Field interaction
S3.2: Standard Solutions Class 1: Build/destroy Class 2: Develop Class 3: Transitions Class 4: Detection Class 5: Application
S3.3: Chain Su-Fields â€¢ Sequential processes â€¢ Parallel processes â€¢ Complex interactions
Model Types: â€¢ Incomplete Su-Field (missing element) â€¢ Harmful Su-Field (unwanted effect) â€¢ Insufficient Su-Field (weak interaction)
Common Fields: â€¢ Mechanical â€¢ Thermal â€¢ Chemical â€¢ Electric â€¢ Magnetic â€¢ Acoustic

ðŸ“ˆ BB5: Trends of Engineering System Evolution
S5.1: S-Curve Position â€¢ Birth (emerging) â€¢ Growth (rapid improvement) â€¢ Maturity (optimization) â€¢ Decline (replacement)
8 Laws of System Evolution:
1. System Completeness 2. Energy Conductivity 3. Harmonization 4. Ideality
5. Uneven Development 6. Transition to Super-system 7. Transition to Micro-level 8. Increasing Use of Fields
S5.3: Forecast Next Stage â€¢ Evolution Potential Radar â€¢ Technology Roadmapping â€¢ Competitive analysis â€¢ Patent landscape
Evolution Patterns: â€¢ Mono â†’ Bi â†’ Poly systems â€¢ Rigid â†’ Flexible â†’ Fluid â†’ Field â€¢ Manual â†’ Semi-auto â†’ Automatic â€¢ 2D â†’ 3D â†’ 4D (time)

ðŸ”¬ BB6: Scientific Effects & Knowledge-Base Search
Effect Categories:
â€¢ Mechanical Effects - Leverage - Resonance - Gyroscopic
â€¢ Thermal Effects - Phase change - Thermal expansion - Peltier effect
â€¢ Chemical Effects - Catalysis - Oxidation - Polymerization
â€¢ Electronic Effects - Piezoelectric - Photoelectric - Semiconductor
â€¢ Magnetic/Optical/Bio - Magnetostriction - Laser effects - Biomimetics
Search Process: 1. Define required function 2. Search effects database (7,000+ effects) 3. Evaluate: Efficiency, Control, Cost, Reliability 4. Patent/literature search for applications
Tools: T4 (Scientific Effects DB), T3 (PatentLens API)
Examples: Shape-memory alloy for valves, Piezoelectric for precision positioning

Analysis Questions: â€¢ What resources exist in each window? â€¢ What constraints apply? â€¢ What opportunities emerge?
Tool: T5 (9-Windows Digital Canvas)
âœ‚ï¸ BB8: Function Trimming
S8.1: Function Ranking â€¢ Value contribution (High/Med/Low) â€¢ Cost (High/Med/Low) â€¢ Harm caused (High/Med/Low)
S8.2: Trimming Rules Rule A: Object self-performs Rule B: Another component performs Rule C: Function eliminated with object
S8.3: Apply Trimming â€¢ Remove low-value components â€¢ Redistribute useful functions â€¢ Eliminate harmful functions
S8.4: Verify System Integrity âœ“ All useful functions preserved âœ“ No new harmful functions âœ“ Cost reduction achieved
Tool: T7 (Function Analysis & Trimming Tool)

âš ï¸ BB12: Anticipatory Failure Determination (AFD)
Inversion technique: 'How can the solution fail?' â†’ Preventive actions
S12.1: Define Ideal Failure â€¢ Most catastrophic scenario â€¢ Plausible failure modes â€¢ Impact assessment
S12.2: Failure Mechanisms â€¢ Cause-Effect Chain Analysis â€¢ Why-Not Diagram â€¢ Failure tree analysis
S12.3: Preventive Actions â€¢ Eliminate root cause â€¢ Compensate with control â€¢ Detect before impact
S12.4: Validation Planning â€¢ Stress test weak points â€¢ Failure mode testing â€¢ Robustness verification
Benefits: Proactive risk management, Higher reliability, Reduced warranty costs, Customer confidence
Integration: AFD results feed into P5 (Implementation) validation plans and risk mitigation
